Thanks a lot for your responses, even though I had done the same way
as Gor=
don said.
the problem was that my default profile was somehow empty, and ea=
ch
time I was testing it, i was modifying a bit and with  bad luck i
never =
had the modules which are necessary: like the ones for
preprocesor and post=
processor...
Anyhow, now that I checked out heritrix again it works fine.
t=
hank you again guys,

cheers,

M.
--- In archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com, G=
ordon Mohr <gojomo@...> wrote:
>
> And '0' means a network-fetch attempt wa=
sn't even made for the URI.
> 
> Seeing -50, -5000, 0 in crawl.log is sugge=
stive of some significant 
> customization of the crawl scoping or processo=
r chain, in a way that
has 
> prevented usual/necessary steps from happenin=
g.
> 
> Suggestion for miro786: start with a default configuration, and mak=
e 
> incremental changes, testing each step of the way. At least then you'l=
l 
> know which latest change went awry.
> 
> - Gordon @ IA
> 
> Bjarne And=
ersen wrote:
> > You can check the fetch status codes in the glossary:
> > =
http://crawler.archive.org/articles/user_manual/glossary.html
> > (Scroll a=
 little down the page)

 robots.txt)

t figure out what happend - maybe try and post your
